abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Serbia Electric Power
            Emergency Reconstruction Project were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: rehabilitation of critical transmission and
            generation facilities (Sremska Mitrovica substation and
            Kostolac Unit A2) is key to restoration of the reliability
            of electricity supply in post-conflict countries, such as
            Serbia, and can result in long-term sustainability that will
            facilitate the integration of such countries in the regional
            market; well-designed project components combined with
            efficient procurement and implementation of the project can
            have significant positive impact on Project outcomes and may
            even result in cost savings that can be used for financing
            of additional project components; introduction of complex IT
            solutions in big organizations such as EPS are notorious for
            delays and require much upfront attention to ensure
            effective implementation; and it may not be appropriate to
            include complex financial management system components in
            emergency projects.
